list_definition.definition: to prevent (someone) from sharing or taking part in something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They excluded her from the meeting.

list_definition.definition: to shut out; to keep out

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Fill the bottle to the top so as to exclude all air.
We cannot exclude the possibility that he was lying.

list_ex_of_english: We are therefore interested here in the crucial situations excluded so far.
If the sky is clear, the requirement is for a daylight factor of about 0.5% and direct sun must be excluded.
The summary scale was recalculated with anger excluded.
They were excluded from formal managerial participation and fringe benefits were seen as their only direct victory.
The mesh size of the gauze allowed parasitoids to pass through and feed on the honey, while excluding the larger bruchids.
All reaction time responses falling below 200 ms (1.58% of all trials) were excluded.
Ten children were excluded from the study as they were found not to have significant eating disturbance.
In the twenty-first century, the study of popular music can no longer be excluded from medieval music study.
